titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Hope Chapel Association was an interdenominational organization that ministered to the spiritual welfare of the residents of Harrison and vicinity and promoted the cause of religion and morality. The Association was affiliated with the Presbyterian Church of Rye, New York.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the Hope Chapel Association of Harrison, New York, 1891-1899. The minutes include discussions of building plans and improvements, reports from committees and officers, including the treasurer, and notes on staffing for chapel services. The volume includes the Association's constitution and by-laws and a list of members.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
